metadata.titel_preek: Easter Season Series: Encountering the Risen Lord

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher provides a narrative-theological exposition of the darkness of death, the inconceivable nature of the resurrection, the role of doubt in faith (Thomas), and the sovereignty of God in suffering (Job).
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong focus on Johannine symbolism (night/light) and the literary structure of Job.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts the reality of the biblical narrative and the nature of God, while occasionally shifting to promising the presence of God in pain.
voorbeelden: I am the resurrection and the life (Quoting Jesus)
We proclaim to you today not our own voice but the living Word of God
The resurrection happened at night

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from doubt/grief to a confession of faith ('My Lord and my God') and to provide comfort in the 'dust' of human existence.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicitly acknowledged in the conclusion of the third sermon.

voorbeelden: The symbolism of night and darkness pervades the Gospel of John.
Jesus has entered the realm of Death.
The book of Job gives no answer at all to the problem of suffering.
Remember this.
Let our answer be hers.
Look at the wonderful things I have made.
It is a very comforting thing to me.
I remember reading about it.
I believe we can hold on to the promise.
God has entered our pain and been wounded by it.
He has power to grant his divine life to all who come to him.
Whoever believes in me... yet shall he live.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong theological grounding, but often framed as 'talking about' the promise rather than 'delivering' it directly.

voorbeelden: Alleluia! Christ is risen!
We proclaim to you today... the living Word of God.
I am comforted that I am dust.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher leans on the authority of the text/liturgy rather than personal apostolic declaration.

indicatoren: Theological explanations of why Job is satisfied.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed about the theology of the resurrection but may feel like an observer of the text rather than a participant in the event.

missende_elementen: Direct present-tense address of the promise to the specific 'you' of the congregation.
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Faith is described as a response to information rather than an immediate result of a creative word.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The promises are largely quoted from Jesus rather than formulated by the preacher as a direct 'Toezegging'.
voorbeelden: Whoever believes in me... yet shall he live.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Used for personal anecdotes (friend's daughter) and to build rapport ('my own struggle to believe').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Directly addressing the hearer's experience of death and doubt ('You will come to know the cold clasp of death').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Mostly used in the 'Law' section (shared suffering) rather than the 'Gospel' section (declaration of grace).

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant mode. Describing Mary, Thomas, Job, and Jesus.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance where the biblical characters are the primary actors.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Narrating the events of Holy Week and the story of Job.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General theological truths about God and human nature.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'Alleluia' and the closing calls to faith.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the darkness of death (Assertive) to the promise of life (Commissive).
voorbeelden: The rising sun revealed the victory... the risen Christ says to us today...
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The link is present but often mediated through 'The Bible says' rather than 'I say to you on behalf of Christ'.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: In believing, receive the gift of eternal light.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is deeply rooted in the Gospel promise and seeks to comfort the hearer, but it does so primarily by explaining the biblical text rather than enacting a sacramental event.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: You will come to know the cold clasp of death.
sterke_punten.effect: Establishes a deep need for the performative word.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The evangelist wants us to know that...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Focuses on the author's intent rather than the Spirit's current action.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a high-quality teaching event that points toward a sacramental encounter, but the language remains largely descriptive.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher acts as an expert guide to the text rather than a mandatory of the living Christ.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is described as the speaker in the text, but the preacher rarely adopts the 'persona Christi'.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Implicitly, through the use of liturgical prayers.
tekstueel_bewijs: We proclaim to you today... the living Word of God.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, in the prayers and the final sermon.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Explicitly stated: 'Through the Word of God the Holy Spirit creates such faith'.
tekstueel_bewijs: raised from the death of sin by thy life-giving Spirit

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon is viewed as a vehicle for the Word, which is the means of grace.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Moderate. Strongest in the Job section regarding 'revelation'.
tekstueel_bewijs: Job's great longing is for revelation.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is', 'was', and 'says'. Need more 'I promise', 'I declare', and 'He gives'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The risen Christ says to us today: 'I am the resurrection'.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Because Christ is risen, I declare to you today: He is your resurrection and your life.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from reporting a past quote to a present-tense ministerial declaration.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: Promises are often nested in 'The Bible says' or 'We believe'.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you who sit in darkness, Christ promises: My light is yours.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Third person dominance in the narrative sections.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interweave the 'you' into the narrative of Mary and Thomas.
voorbeeldzinnen: Like Mary, you stand at the tomb; and like to Mary, He calls your name.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A theologically rich and pastorally sensitive sermon series that would benefit from a bolder illocutionary stance to truly become a 'sacramental event'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the preacher isn't just 'sending a message' about hope, but 'performing' the hope of the resurrection through the Word.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here is not in the preacher's metaphors for darkness, but in the 'Commissives' where God binds Himself to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's 'event-character' is hindered by the 'Constative Surplus' of historical-exegetical reporting.

expressief: is a very comforting thing to me
declaratief: I am comforted that I am dust

kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: The most performative moment, changing the atmosphere from 'talking about' to 'celebrating'.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I am the resurrection and the life.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Strong because it is a quote of Jesus, but functions as an assertive 'fact' in the sermon's flow.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: You will come to know the cold clasp of death.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Very effective direct address that creates existential 'locutionary' pressure.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a masterclass in 'Theological Constative'—it explains the faith beautifully. To move to 'Sacramental Performative', it needs to dare to speak *for* God more directly in the present tense.
